job.description:
About Agoda

At Agoda, we bridge the world through travel. Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world.

Today, we are part of Booking Holdings [NASDAQ: BKNG], with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe. Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.

No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If youâre ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us.

Get to know our team:

The B2B Pricing team sits within B2B Marketing and partners with Product, Commercial, Finance, and Data Science to define, test, and scale strategies that drive sustainable growth and profitability for Agoda and our partners. We combine deep analytical rigor with an experimentation mindset to optimize across marketing levers (primarily pricing) and advise on growth across B2B2C channels.

The Opportunity:

As Manager, B2B Pricing, you will own pricing strategy and execution while acting as a consultative, dataâdriven advisor to B2B2C growth initiatives. Youâll translate commercial goals into testable pricing and marketing levers, design measurement, and lead crossâfunctional rollouts that improve business outcomes. You will work closely with the commercial organization and crossâfunctional stakeholders, serving as a goâto partner for pricing and growth decisions for key partners (e.g., large loyalty programs, marketplaces, and digital wallets such as Rakuten or Paytm).

In this role, youâll get to:

  • Define and evolve pricing strategies, segmentation, and marketing action for partners.
  • Lead the experimentation roadmap (A/B and multivariate tests), including hypotheses, success metrics, and decision frameworks.
  • Build marketing roadmaps and analyses (elasticity, cannibalization, incrementality) to advise relevant marketing actions.
  • Act as a consultative growth advisor to partner teams: coâcreate joint plans, model impact/P&L, align OKRs, and operationalize execution across channels.
  • Build playbooks to scale winning strategies across markets and partners; document learnings and institutionalize best practices.
  • Create Tableau dashboards and crisp executive narratives that synthesize performance, insights, and recommendations; drive action in weekly/monthly reviews.
  • Vendor/Partner Management: Manage relationships with external partners including strategic presentations.

What youâll need to succeed:

  • 5+ years in data-driven role, revenue/growth, marketing, strategy, or analytics roles in eâcommerce, travel, tech;
  • Strong business acumen and structured problemâsolving; ability to frame tradeâoffs, model scenarios, and influence decisions with clear âsoâwhat.â
  • Fluency with data: advanced Excel, SQL, and Tableau; comfort with large datasets and experiment readouts.
  • Practical experience with controlled experiments.
  • Exceptional stakeholder management and communication; able to simplify complex analyses for senior and partner audiences and drive alignment.
  • High ownership and bias for action; thrive in an ambiguous, fastâpaced, testâandâlearn environment.
  • BA/BS in a quantitative field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Engineering) or equivalent experience.

Itâs great if you have:

  • Building decision frameworks in production.
  • Background in management consulting or internal strategy (e.g., growth, pricing, or partnerships).
  • MBA or advanced degree is a plus; we value equivalent operating experience and measurable outcomes.
  • Familiarity with Python/R for modeling and scaling analysis.
  • Domain exposure to B2B channels, partner/affiliate programs, or wholesale/whitelabel constructs.

Accor Tech & Digital is the innovation and technological transformation lab of the world leader in hospitality.

Our teams, known as HeartistsÂ®, bring together the best of hospitality with the best of tech and digital. Our ambition is to provide our customers with personalized, memorable, and sustainable experiences.

Here, we create new ways to travel within each of our 5,500 hotels, connecting closely with our 100 million clients in 110 countries.

Here, we are at the heart of an incredible playground for technological transition and the design of digital products and services for our customers and hotel teams.

Here, your scope will know no boundaries;

So join us and dare to make an impact on the world!

Within the Global Revenue Strategy team, the Manager of Rate Integrity & Compliance will contribute to All.accor.com strength by chasing parity issues, and also to hotels & Accor RGI . He/She will establish a process in coordination with MEAPAC and La Maison for Parity issues.

Strategy

  • Proven exceptional organizational skills and results drive approach
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate and build confidence with stakeholders

  • Deep expertise is systems (GDS,, Switches, distribution tools)
  • Team building/motivation and change management capabilities
  • Experience in multiple markets and segments, with a proven track record of driving results and achieving projects in a complex, cross-functional matrix organisation
  • Excellent communication, negotiation and stakeholder engagement skills
  • Proven ability to lead in high-pressure, multi-cultural environments

Additional Information

  • Every Wednesday afternoon, dedicate your time to deep work and personal development.
  • Work in a multicultural and English-speaking environment.
  • Continuous improvement & training: Hackathons, exceptional technology partnerships, dedicated talent management, and a dedicated training platform, Digitech Academy & certifications.

and also,

  • HeartistÂ® for Good Program: commit to supporting an association of your choice from those available on our volunteering platform (1 day offered per year by the Group during your working hours).

Role Summary

The Delivery Associate Director is responsible for leading and driving high-impact operations delivery across one or more service areas. This person ensures quality, efficiency, and client value by aligning delivery outcomes with business objectives and operational excellence. They partner deeply with internal delivery leadership, cross-functional teams, and client stakeholders to sustain performance, embed continuous improvement, and support strategic growth. This role focuses on execution, operational performance, and delivery leadership rather than direct sales or account expansion.

  • Use data-driven insights to identify operational improvement opportunities and lead initiatives that enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and strengthen quality controls.
  • Sponsor delivery excellence programs, including process design, automation, and analytics adoption where appropriate.

job.title: SAP Data Senior Manager - Mid-Market
job.description:
We Are

Accenture has established a unified, public-cloud-first strategy for the Mid Market segment, designed to maximize SAP Cloud adoption and deliver rapid, outcome-led transformation. The strategy is structured around monetizing solution gaps through modular industry packages.

Mid-Market companies are undergoing a significant transformation, driven by the need to modernize operations, accelerate growth, and respond to evolving industry demands. Their core priorities include rapid cloud adoption, outcome-led business transformation, and the ability to scale efficiently across regions and industries. There is a strong focus on leveraging modular, industry-specific solutions, improving operational agility, and achieving measurable business outcomes.

Accentureâs differentiated offerings include SAP pre-configured industry solutions, implementation accelerators, managed services foundations, and digital maturity enablement. We bring reinvention to life using design thinking, modern delivery methodologies, embedding AI into the way we deliver and into business processes.

This strategy delivers faster time to market, reduced implementation risk and complexity, seamless solution adoption, industry-aligned upskilling, reduced customization effort, and improved decision-making for mid-market clients.

We are the industry-leader for building SAP solutions and weâre curious and always learning. The Products industry is going through remarkable levels of transformation as they are responding to rapidly evolving consumer needs and market forces, and transforming internal operations for efficiencies â all of this underpinned by technology.

SAP technologies power these organizations with modern cloud-based and AI-enabled solutions, and Accenture is the undisputed market leader and partner of choice in this industry. We are looking to expand our SAP team with the best delivery talent, who have experience in the mid-market, across the business suite, and across functions, that will enable us to continue to drive transformations at scale.

You Are

You are a transformational leader who thrives in the complexity of large-scale SAP programs. job.description:
We Are

Accenture Song accelerates growth and value for our clients through sustained customer relevance. Our capabilities span ideation to execution: growth, product and experience design; technology and experience platforms; creative, media and marketing strategy; and campaign, content and channel orchestration. With strong client relationships and deep industry expertise, we help our clients operate at the speed of life through the unlimited potential of imagination, technology and intelligence. Visit us at: <a href="http://www.accenture.com/song" target="_blank" data-cmp-clickable="" data-cmp-data-layer="{"jobdetail-1e0b7e5710-Job Description-item0":{"analytics-link-name":"www.accenture.com/song","analytics-link-type":"engagement","xdm:linkURL":"http://www.accenture.com/song","analytics-engagement":"true"}}" rel="noopener noreferrer">www.accenture.com/song.

You Are

As a Senior Manager in Accentureâs Lead-to-Cash (L2C) practice within Song Sales & Commerce, you will shape, sell, and deliver enterprise-scale commercial and revenue operations transformations, with deep expertise in Order-to-Cash (O2C). You will operate as a trusted advisor to C-suite and senior executives, helping clients modernize how Sales, Pricing, Contracts, Order Management, Billing, AR, and Cash Collection work together to accelerate revenue, improve customer experience, and optimize cash outcomes.

This role goes beyond traditional finance-led O2C transformations. You will bring a front-office, customer-centric lens, ensuring O2C capabilities are tightly aligned with Sales, Customer Service, Pricing, and Revenue Operations to drive growth, margin, and liquidity at scale.

Key Responsibilities

  • Advise C-suite and senior executives across Sales, Revenue Operations, Customer Experience, and Finance on end-to-end Lead-to-Cash and O2C strategy
  • Shape transformation roadmaps balancing revenue acceleration, customer experience, and cash optimization
  • Lead executive workshops, steering committees, and board-level discussions
  • Own and lead large-scale programs across Order Management, Billing & Invoicing, AR, Payments, Disputes, and Cash Collection
  • Ensure seamless integration between front-office (CRM, CPQ, Contracts) and back-office (ERP, Billing, Finance)
  • Define and operationalize global O2C operating models across regions and business units
  • Lead technology-enabled transformations involving ERP, Billing, AR, CPQ, CRM, and O2C automation platforms
  • Drive adoption of automation, analytics, and AI-enabled O2C capabilities
  • Build, mentor, and scale high-performing global teams
  • Contribute to practice growth through thought leadership, proposals, and executive pursuits

Scope of Coverage

  • Lead Generation & Opportunity Management (strategic context)
  • Product Configuration & Pricing Management
  • RFP & Quote Management
  • Rebate & Contract Management
  • Order Management
  • Billing & Invoicing
  • Accounts Receivable & Payments
  • Cash Collection & Dispute Management
  • Revenue Operations & Performance Management

What Sets This Role Apart

  • Positions Order-to-Cash as a commercial and customer experience differentiator
  • Combines strategy, technology, and operating model leadership at enterprise scale
  • High visibility with senior clients and Accenture leadership
  • Clear path to Managing Director through impact and practice growt

Here Is What You'll Need

  • 12+ years of experience leading Lead-to-Cash and/or Order-to-Cash transformations, including: proven track record delivering large, complex, technology-enabled O2C programs, strong front-office and customer-facing experience beyond finance, experience advising senior executives and leading enterprise change,
  • 5+ years of prior consulting experience with accountability for delivery and growth

What Will Set You Apart

  • Deep experience with ERP and O2C platforms (SAP ECC / S/4HANA, Oracle, Salesforce, CPQ)
  • Exposure to automation, analytics, and AI use cases in O2C
  • Experience in complex, global, multi-entity organizations
  • Industry experience in Industrials, Logistics, CMT, Consumer, or Utilities

job.title: Delivery Lead Associate Director
job.description:
Role Summary

The Delivery Associate Director is responsible for leading and driving high-impact operations delivery across one or more service areas. This person ensures quality, efficiency, and client value by aligning delivery outcomes with business objectives and operational excellence. They partner deeply with internal delivery leadership, cross-functional teams, and client stakeholders to sustain performance, embed continuous improvement, and support strategic growth. This role focuses on execution, operational performance, and delivery leadership rather than direct sales or account expansion.

Key Responsibilities

Delivery Leadership

  • Lead end-to-end delivery operations for assigned programs or service lines, ensuring operational commitments are met on time, within quality standards, and aligned to contractual SLAs/KPIs.
  • Define, implement, and refine delivery processes, governance, and controls that improve operational predictability and service quality.
  • Partner with senior delivery leadership to align on priorities, forecast demand, balance supply, and advise on escalation and risk mitigation.
  • Act as a senior escalation point for delivery issues, resolving complex challenges that impact performance or client satisfaction.

Client and Stakeholder Engagement

  • Maintain strong relationships with key client stakeholders and internal leadership to ensure delivery outcomes align with expectations and long-term operational goals.
  • Represent delivery performance, forecasts, risks, and improvement plans to senior stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with internal counterparts (e.g., Technology, Strategy, Quality, HR) to ensure integrated delivery and shared accountability for outcomes.

People Leadership and Development

  • Develop and mentor senior managers and team leads, setting clear expectations, performance objectives, and career growth pathways.
  • Promote a culture of continuous improvement, accountability, and development within delivery teams.
  • Lead workforce planning and skill development initiatives to ensure the right talent mix for current and future delivery needs.

Operational Excellence and Improvement

  • Use data-driven insights to identify operational improvement opportunities and lead initiatives that enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and strengthen quality controls.
  • Sponsor delivery excellence programs, including process design, automation, and analytics adoption where appropriate.
  • Ensure compliance with internal frameworks and external regulatory or contractual requirements.

Basic Qualifications

  • Minimum of 10 years experience in operations delivery, program management, or service delivery leadership, preferably in a large global services environment.
  • Minimum of 5 years experience managing client relationships
  • Minimum of 3 years experience managing a P&L

Preferred Qualifications

  • Prior BPO/BPS
  • Customer Experience and/or Supply chain
  • Exposure to AI technologies/transformation

Professional Skills

  • Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage complex delivery portfolios.
  • Strong stakeholder management and communication skills, with experience interacting at senior levels.
  • Demonstrated track record of driving operational performance improvements and leading organizational change.

Who We Are

We are Industry X: We embed innovation, intelligence, and sustainability in the way the world makes things and the things it makes. Industry X enables leaders to act quickly and confidently as they pivot to the future. We define Industry X as digital reinvention of manufacturing / engineering and believe that smart, sustainable, connected digital products and assets are about to create hyper-personalized industrial experiences, completely new levels of operational efficiency, transparency and traceability, tangible impact on sustainability and brand-new sources of revenue growth. Known for our ability to execute at speed, we help clients determine clear, actionable paths to competitive agility by bringing them new thinking on business and technology. The Practice

This role will align with Industry Xâs Go-To-Market (GTM) practice area

Go-To-Market (GTM) team members bring engineering, manufacturing and infrastructure & capital projects expertise to work with our market teams across Accenture, to originate work and create industry-relevant solutions that help our clients build a more sustainable world.

The Work

Accenture Industry X helps clients reimagine product engineering, manufacturing operations, and digital thread enablement by combining deep industry expertise with digital technologies such as PLM/MES platforms, Digital Twin, automation, and AI. Our Siemens practice enables Fortune 500 manufacturers to transform how products are designed, built, operated, and serviced.

We are seeking a highly driven Go-to-Market (GTM) Sales Lead to accelerate growth in our Siemens engineering and manufacturing services portfolio within key industries such as Automotive, Aerospace & Defense, Industrial/Heavy Equipment, Consumer Products, and High Tech.

This Director-level role will focus on originating, shaping, and progressing opportunities across Siemens platformsâincluding Teamcenter, Opcenter, Tecnomatix, Plant Simulation, and digital twin solutionsâpartnering closely with Client Account Leads, ecosystem partners, and delivery leaders. The ideal candidate brings a strong industry network, consultative selling expertise, and the ability to translate Industry X offerings into compelling, client-specific value propositions.

Key Responsibilities

GTM Strategy & Sales Origination

  • Originate, shape, and progress Siemens-based transformation opportunities to drive $30â$40M+ in annual sourced pipeline.

Client Engagement & Relationship Management

  • Serve as a trusted advisor to senior engineering, IT, manufacturing, and operations stakeholders.

  • Collaborate with Client Account Leads and Industry leadership to prioritize pursuits and qualify early-stage opportunities.

Offerings & Solution Shaping

  • Work cross-functionally to shape PLM, MES/MOM, digital twin, model-based engineering, and plant simulation transformation programs.
  • Align Accenture differentiated offerings with client pain points and value levers across digital engineering and manufacturing.

Pursuit Leadership & RFP Progression

  • Lead sales governance through qualification, discovery, solutioning, and proposal cycles.
  • Progress opportunities to RFP, proposal, and Orals stages, partnering with pursuit teams and SMEs.
  • Recommend commercial models, deal structuring, and delivery approach.

Partner Ecosystem Engagement

  • Collaborate with Siemens account teams, hyperscalers (AWS/Azure/Google Cloud), and SAP ecosystem partners to shape integrated digital thread solutions.
  • Build joint GTM plays and co-selling motions.

Thought Leadership & Market Presence

  • Represent Accenture at industry events, Siemens Realize LIVE, webinars, and partner forums.
  • Develop white papers, points-of-view (POVs), and storytelling assets to fuel demand generation.
  • Contribute to internal enablement and sales playbooks

Hereâs What You Need

  • 12 years of experience with large consulting/system integrators selling engineering and manufacturing technology services.
  • Proven track record of originating, qualifying, and progressing complex transformation deals into formal RFP cycles.
  • Demonstrated experience with Siemens platforms such as:
    • Teamcenter (PLM)
    • Opcenter (MES/MOM)
    • Tecnomatix / Process Simulate
    • Plant Simulation
    • Digital Twin/Digital Thread concepts
  • Deep expertise in one of the following domains:
    • PLM implementations
    • MES/MOM transformation
  • Strong understanding of digital engineering and smart manufacturing processes.
Bonus Points If You Have

  • Prior experience working with, or partnering closely with, Siemens in a delivery or sales capacity.
  • Familiarity with hyperscale GTM models (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and SAP integration within digital thread architectures.
  • Experience selling to clients in Automotive, Aerospace & Defense, Industrial, Consumer Products, or High Tech industries.
  • Experience collaborating with manufacturing engineering, plant operations, and R&D stakeholders.

Job Description

Key Responsibilities

Brand & Communications Strategy

  • Develop and execute an integrated PR and communications strategy that supports brand awareness, revenue goals, and market positioning

job.description:
We Are

Our Logic, Part of Accenture team has strong retail-focused capabilities in technology services to help our clients navigate business transformation and deliver exceptional shopping experiences that seamlessly blend physical and digital worlds. Having joined Accenture in August 2024, Logic delivers on comprehensive retail initiatives to help clients thrive in a dynamic market and expand Accentureâs reach to new tiers of retailers. This team focuses on working with growing retailers to move faster, innovate smarter, and thrive in the face of retail disruption. With Logic, you will join a team with over 25 yearsâ experience working with leading retailers around the world. Logicâs nimble approach backed by proven retail accelerators and deep retail industry expertise, the teamâs capabilities in merchandising, stores, digital, analytics and cloud further enhance Accentureâs ability to drive transformations for a broader range of retail clients globally. Join Logic, Part of Accenture and help bring their clients retail future to life today.

The Work

The Sales Director manages the opportunity from sales pursuit to close using deep sales process and offering expertise. Develop relationships with key buyers and decision makers at new and existing client projects and grow the business. Act as point of contact for resolution and escalation of all key items with the client and internally.

A professional at this position level within Accenture has the following responsibilities:

  • Provides solutions to complex business problems for areas of responsibility where analysis of situations requires an in-depth knowledge of organizational objectives.
  • Involved in setting strategic direction to establish near term goals for area of responsibility.
  • Interacts with senior management levels at a client and/or within Accenture, which involves negotiating or influencing significant matters.
  • Has latitude in decision making and determining objectives and approaches to critical assignments.
  • Decisions have a lasting impact on the area of responsibility with the potential to impact outside area of responsibility.
  • Manage large teams and/or work efforts if in an individual contributor role at a client or within Accenture.

Additionally, As a Retail Industry-focused Sales Director, You Will

  • Actively originate new business opportunities and secure new client logos through your industry expertise and network of contacts
  • Cultivate and leverage a strong network within the retail industry to identify new sales opportunities
  • Develop value-led sales strategies that address critical challenges in the retail space
  • Position Accenture's retail capabilities and thought leadership to differentiate in competitive sales scenarios
  • Apply deep retail industry knowledge to create compelling proposals and presentations that resonate with client executives
  • Navigate complex retail buyer landscapes, identifying and engaging key decision makers
  • Bring an understanding of current retail market dynamics, competitive pressures, and emerging industry trends to sales conversations
  • Provide industry context and credibility in client meetings, drawing on practical retail knowledge

job.description:
Company Description

About Orient Express

Artisan of travel since 1883, Orient Express sublimates the art of travel with its luxury trains, hotels, and sailing yachts. The brand has just launched its first hotel, Orient Express La Minerva, in Rome â which will be followed by Orient Express Venezia at Palazzo DonÃ  Giovannelli in 2026. The experience continues with the recent launch of La Dolce Vita Orient Express train, followed by Orient Express Corinthian in 2026, the first of two Orient Express Sailing Yachts, and finally, the return of LâOrient Express train to railways. Since 2022, Orient Express is part of Accor Groupâs leading collection of luxury brands with a century-old legacy in the hotels and fine- dining sectors. In 2024, Accor and LVMH entered into a strategic partnership to accelerate the development of Orient Express. Follow the journey at @orientexpress on Instagram or visit the website at www.orient-express.com.

About Orient Express Sailing Yachts

140 years after the launch of its first luxury trains, the Orient Express legend continues with the launch of the world's largest sailing ships, the Orient Express Corinthian. A revolution in maritime history, and a fabulous project that pushes back the limits of what is possible. The result of a unique French partnership between Accor, the world leader in hospitality, and Chantiers de l'Atlantique, the world's leading cruise ship builder. This extraordinary sailing ship of the future, with its spectacular interiors, will set sail in 2026.

Job Description

Dedicated to Orient Express Sailing Yachts, the Director of Sales (for the US market) is a strategic leadership role responsible for developing and executing comprehensive sales strategies. This position involves defining and implementing action plans aligned with objectives and strategies, advising on tactical activities, and overseeing various aspects of sales management.

Reporting directly to the VP Sales & Marketing at Orient Express Sailing Yachts , the Director of Sales will :

Define and Implement Action Plans

  • Develop comprehensive action plans in alignment with defined objectives and sales strategies.
  • Ensure the execution of plans to achieve long-term objectives while adapting to evolving market conditions.

Tactical Activities

  • Advise and implement tactical activities to achieve short-term sales objectives.
  • Collaborate closely with global sales teams and internal resources to drive effective and targeted sales campaigns.

Revenue Monitoring

  • Monitor sales revenue, analyse performance data, and collaborate with revenue management to optimize pricing and revenue strategies.
  • Implement corrective actions based on data insights to enhance revenue performance.

Professional Events Representation

  • Coordinate and represent the portfolio at professional events to strengthen relationships with key industry stakeholders.
  • Leverage events to identify new business opportunities and enhance brand visibility.

Account Portfolio Management

  • Manage a portfolio of key accounts, nurturing relationships and maximizing revenue opportunities.
  • Collaborate with global sales teams to identify and pursue new account acquisition opportunities.

Guidance and Training

  • Provide guidance and training to Accor global sales teams, ensuring a consistent approach and understanding of the leisure segment.

Reporting and Business Intelligence

  • Establish periodic reports and business intelligence to track performance against objectives.
  • Utilize data-driven insights to inform decision-making and optimize sales strategies.

Budget Management

  • Take responsibility for the budget allocated to the leisure segment, ensuring effective allocation of resources to achieve strategic goals.

Team Leadership

  • Lead and inspire the sales team, fostering a collaborative and high-performance culture.
  • Provide direction, mentorship, and support to achieve individual and team targets.

Qualifications

Preferable Bakground:

  • Masterâs degree in business, Marketing, Hospitality, or a related field.
  • Minimum of 5 years of progressive experience in sales, with experience in a leadership role.
  • Proven track record of success in leisure sales within the travel and tourism industry. Train or cruising industry is a plus.

Competencies

  • In-depth understanding of the travel agencies and tour operating world. Familiarity with luxury travel, trains, and cruise segments.
  • Strong leadership and team management skills. Ability to inspire and motivate a sales team toward common goals.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to effectively communicate with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to use data-driven insights to inform decision-making.
  • Proven ability to drive sales growth and meet revenue targets.
  • Excellent networking and relationship-building skills within the leisure travel industry in the US.
  • Strong negotiation skills, particularly in contract negotiations with travel agencies and tour operators.
  • Ability to adapt to changing market conditions and implement effective strategies accordingly.
  • Familiarity with sales and CRM tools. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite.

Additional Information

Visa Requirements: Must Legally be authorized to work in the United States

  • Salary Range $115,000-165,000 annually
  • Excellent Company benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and 401K Retirement plan.
  • Employee benefit card offering discounted rates in Accor worldwide for you and your family.

Our Commitment To Diversity & Inclusion

We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit and promote diverse talent.

Why work for Accor?

We are far more than a worldwide leader. We welcome you as you are and you can find a job and brand that matches your personality.

We support you to grow and learn every day, making sure that work brings purpose to your life, so that during your journey with us, you can continue to explore Accorâs limitless possibilities.

job.description:
Company Description

Sofitel Luxembourg Europe

French luxury and local cuisine in the world's most exciting city

The only 5 star Hotel on the Kirchberg Plateau, surrounded by the European Institutions and a short walk from the new exhibition center, the Sofitel Luxembourg Europe is the ideal place to stay for business or leisure. Unwind at one of the nearby cultural attractions, or simply enjoy the many dining options on offer at the hotel.

Job Description

The Director of Operations is responsible for assisting with the planning and managing of the overall operations of the hotel to achieve customer (guests, employees, corporate and owners) satisfaction and quality service while meeting/exceeding financial goals.

He will plan, organize, direct and coordinate management activities of the operations in conjunction with the General Manager. He/she is responsible for delivering results that contribute to the mission and overall success of the hotel. The Director of Operation will take on responsibility for the hotel in the absence of the General Manager.

Main Responsibilities

Business Performance

  • Support the annual budgeting process and financial forecast for the operations departments
  • Ensure that all operations departments are maximizing revenue and profit potentials while minimizing costs and staying within budget guideline
  • Analyze monthly P&L and month-end reports, identify deviation from business plan goals

Operation

  • Ensures guest and employee satisfaction, while maintaining market competitiveness and exceptional financial performance
  • Develop, recommend, implement and manage the operational departmentâs annual and long term goals
  • Ensures optimal compliance with corporate focus audit, local health and safety, and other statutory regulations
  • Represent the Brand in projecting a credible image to the market, residents and colleagues alike
  • Help and support in establishment of positive owner relations

Customer relations

  • Conveys the Sofitel pillars to guests by playing a hands-on role in the hotel, embodying sociability and proximity

Team Management

  • Manage performance issues that arise within the operational departments. Train, develop, coach and counsel, conduct performance evaluations and resolve problems of departmental team members and managers
  • Constantly monitor team members performance, attitude and degree of professionalism

Commercial / Sales

  • Instils a sales mindset to employees through continuous stimulation (upselling, incentives, challengesâ¦)
  • Provides suggestions for the Sales Manager concerning all offers on sale.

Qualifications

Knowledge and Experience

  • Bachelorâs Degree from a reputable hospitality school preferred
  • Minimum 5 years of operational management experience with strong Rooms and / or F&B background or at least 2 years of experience in a similar capacity
  • High degree of professionalism with strong understanding of hotel operations and business acumen
  • Excellent reading, writing and oral proficiency in English language
  • Ability to communicate in a local language where the hotel operates is desirable
  • Strong working knowledge of MS Excel, Word, & PowerPoint

Competencies

  • Strong leadership, interpersonal and training skills
  • Ability to lead expatriates and local colleagues effectively
  • Excellent communication and customer contact skills
  • Results and service oriented with an eye for details
  • Ability to multi-task, work well in stressful & high-pressure situations
  • A team player & builder
  • A motivator & self-starter
  • Well-presented and professionally groomed at all times

Additional Information

What We Offer

At Accor, we are dedicated to helping you reach your potential by providing an enriching and fulfilling career experience. When you join our team, you gain access to:

  • Development Opportunities: We offer continuous career growth and development within a world-leading hospitality group, with over 5,700 hotels globally.
  • Competitive Salary: We recognize and reward your talents with a highly competitive compensation package.
  • Extensive Training: Through Accor Academy, you have access to a wealth of learning resources and training programs designed to support your growth and development in your role.
  • Global Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted accommodation at Accor properties worldwide and exclusive discounts on food and beverages across our network.
  • Supportive Culture: We prioritize a collaborative environment that celebrates each team member's contributions.

A Purposeful Career Awaits

Our hotels lead the way in sustainability, diversity, and inclusion, fostering a culture where everyone belongs. We are committed to creating a workplace that gives purpose, empowers individuals to thrive, and encourages each person to unlock their full potential. Join us in shaping a brighter future in hospitality while making a positive impact on the world around us.

and also,

  • Arrange presentations to hotels & clients on key topics , new openings and products

job.description:
Company Description

Join the Accor Group, an ecosystem of over 45 brands, 5,500 hotels, 10,000 restaurants, and lifestyle destinations.

With us, your personality is valued, your opportunities for growth know no boundaries. Every action you take can have a positive and memorable impact on the experience of our customers, your colleagues, and also, on the planet, contributing to pioneering the art of responsible hospitality.

About ASTORE

Astore is our Global Procurement Organization, which covers all products & services needed by our clients to address their daily operational needs or one-shot construction and renovation projects. Astore is collaborating with 3,500 suppliers offering products and services necessary to ensure the proper functioning of all hospitality businesses. With a team of 200 experts serving 7,000 customers in 20 countries, Astore negotiates some of the best prices and conditions on the market. Astore is a fast-growing and innovative department operating in an increasingly competitive environment.

The Europe & North African (ENA) Astore team is responsible for sourcing, negotiating and promoting its products and services in 50 Countries, across Europe, CIS and North Africa.

You will join a caring environment and a team where you can be all you are. You will be in a supportive place to grow, to fulfil yourself, to discover other professions and to pursue career opportunities, in your hotel or in other hospitality environments, in your country or anywhere in the world!

Become a HeartistÂ®, and let your heart guide you into a world where life pulses with passion.

#WeAreHeartists

To discover the life that awaits you at Accor, visit https://careers.accor.com/.

Job Description

Are you passionate about forging impactful partnerships and shaping commercial strategies? Join our multicultural ASTORE team as a Business Development Manager for Accorâs Procurement Services and take on a pivotal role in supporting our Hotel Partners and -Clients in the region. Youâll be at the heart of commercial relationships across France, helping drive value and procurement success.

What will you do?

  • You own the commercial relationship, with our Hotel partners, focused particularly on key stakeholders such as top management within hotels and partners, hotel owners, asset managers, and hotel GMs, as well as operations
  • Pilot business development activity through performance analysis, KPI monitoring, pipeline development, and regular reporting

  • Grow and sustain purchasing volumes with existing and new partners by identifying additional opportunities and deploying tailored action plans
  • Recruit new partner networks and establishments with strong purchasing potential, from prospecting to negotiation and contract finalization

Qualifications

  • Comfortable working in multi-partner environments; experience in a purchasing group or central procurement structure is a plus

  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate insights into actionable development plans
  • Strong communication, negotiation, and relationship-building skills

About Agoda

At Agoda, we bridge the world through travel. Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world.

Today, we are part of Booking Holdings [NASDAQ: BKNG], with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe. Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.

No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If youâre ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us.

Summary

In the online travel industry, with fast changing user behavior and the increasing role played by price comparison websites, offering the best price grants disproportionate gains. Travelers chose Agoda because they are confident that they can find there the best hotels, at the best price. Success can only be achieved by combining a programmatic approach to optimize volumes and margins in the short term with a strategic approach to take into account the reactions from the other players in the game, from customers to hotels, from competitors to regulatory bodies. To this end, we are looking for a senior leader to craft Agodaâs global marketing strategy and execute upon it, using a wide range of tactics and tools, from price display to machine learning algorithms. You will closely coordinate with Agodaâs senior management, marketing and product teams, while managing and expanding a team of talented pricing campaign managers and analysts.

What you will be doing:

  • Strategy Development: Develop and refine PPC strategy in line with overall business goals and market trends.
  • Performance Management: Monitor channel performance and efficiency (ROI, spend, and other key KPIs).
  • Stakeholder Communication: Regularly communicate performance, insights, and recommendations to senior leadership and cross-functional teams.
  • Process Improvement: Identify and implement process improvements to increase team efficiency and campaign effectiveness.
  • Vendor/Partner Management: Manage relationships with external partners (e.g., Google, Bing, agencies) and negotiate contracts or terms as needed.
  • Talent Development: Mentor, train, and develop team members to build skills and support career growth.
  • Innovation & Experimentation: Foster a culture of testing and innovation, encouraging the team to explore new channels, tools, and bidding strategies.
  • Insights: Analyze and explore data to seed projects, understand test performance, and execute on key team goals that require complex implementation or analysis.

What you need to be good at to succeed in this role:

  • Strong analytical skills and a passion for working with data to drive business decisions.
  • Advance proficiency in SQL
  • Experience in the online travel or e-commerce industry is a plus.
  • Proven ability to collaborate effectively across teams and cultures.
  • People management experience, including hiring, coaching, and developing team members.
  • Experience managing budgets and delivering results against financial targets.
  • A proactive, entrepreneurial mindset with a strong sense of ownership and a get-things-done attitude.
  • Exposure to product development, technology, or working with IT teams is an advantage.

job.title: Manager/Senior Manager, Strategic Revenue & Growth Management (Bangkok-based, relocation provided)
job.description:
About Agoda

At Agoda, we bridge the world through travel. Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world.

Today, we are part of Booking Holdings [NASDAQ: BKNG], with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe. Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.

No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If youâre ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us.

Role Summary

Agoda is looking for a strategic, data-driven leader to steer our global marketing investments. In this role, you arenât just spending a budget; you are managing a global P&L. You will bridge the gap between high-level financial targets and granular marketing execution, ensuring every dollar spent maximizes long-term profitability. You will define our global market strategy, own our Lifetime Value (LTV) frameworks, and lead a high-performing team to outpace the competition in a high-velocity travel market.

This position grants you a "seat at the table" for Agodaâs most critical commercial decisions. You will use machine learning and predictive analytics to solve the "game theory" of the online travel industry, where pricing and loyalty change by the hour.

Key Responsibilities: What You Will Do

  • P&L Stewardship: Drive marketing investment strategies to meet Finance P&L targets, balancing short-term volume with long-term margin optimization.
  • Strategic Growth Strategy: Define and execute Agodaâs global growth roadmap, identifying market opportunities and responding to competitor moves in real-time.
  • Investment Orchestration: Coordinate marketing spend across all digital channels (Performance, Brand, Meta) to ensure a cohesive and efficient global footprint.
  • LTV & Unit Economics: Together with the data science team, own and refine our definition of Lifetime Value (LTV); use these insights to shift the business toward high-value customer acquisition.
  • Forecasting & Modeling: Lead business forecasting efforts to predict market shifts and proactively adjust investment levels.
  • Cross-Functional Leadership: Act as the primary liaison between Marketing, Corporate Strategy, Product, Finance and Supply to align and execute cross-functional initiatives.
  • Team Development: Lead and mentor a team of analysts, fostering a culture of rigorous experimentation and "get-things-done" ownership.

Experience & Skills: What You Need to Succeed

  • Analytical Rigor: Exceptional ability to translate complex data sets into actionable business strategies. Expertise in SQL, Excel, or data visualization tools is expected.
  • Commercial Acumen: Strong background in Revenue Management, Forecasting, Pricing, or Growth Equity. You understand how marketing levers impact the bottom line.
  • Strategic Mindset: Experience defining 1â3 year growth strategies in a global, fast-paced e-commerce or OTA environment.
  • Product Exposure: Familiarity with machine learning algorithms and technical product developmentâyou can speak the language of engineers and data scientists.
  • Leadership: Experience hiring and coaching high-potential talent in a multicultural, high-pressure environment.

job.title: Strategy Senior Manager | Sales & Commerce Reinvention | Insurance
job.description:
We Are

Accenture Song accelerates growth and value for our clients through sustained customer relevance. Our capabilities span ideation to execution: growth, product and experience design; technology and experience platforms; creative, media and marketing strategy; and campaign, content and channel orchestration. With strong client relationships and deep industry expertise, we help our clients operate at the speed of life through the unlimited potential of imagination, technology, and intelligence. Visit us at: <a href="http://www.accenture.com/song" target="_blank" data-cmp-clickable="" data-cmp-data-layer="{"jobdetail-1e0b7e5710-Job Description-item0":{"analytics-link-name":"www.accenture.com/song","analytics-link-type":"engagement","xdm:linkURL":"http://www.accenture.com/song","analytics-engagement":"true"}}" rel="noopener noreferrer">www.accenture.com/song.

You Are

An experienced professional with deep growth strategy and front office transformation experience with focus in these sub-industries: insurance, wealth management, retirement services. Additional experience across other services industries is welcome. Key areas you focus on may include sales (advisor) enablement, go-to-market strategies, direct to consumer growth, lead management, and sales operating model design. You are a problem solver with extensive consulting (preferred) and/or industry experience who is comfortable working in fast-paced, agile environments. You have experience managing executive level client relationships as a trusted advisor, facilitating workshops, developing business recommendations, and building business cases for AI/GenAI. You know how to balance leading your team with contributing to the teamâs collective work products.

You Also Are

  • Passionate about helping clients solve complex growth and customer experience challenges, and supporting them through strategic transformations.
  • Knowledgeable about the nuances of the Financial Services industry broadly, and insurance specifically, as well as front-line sales and commerce organizations, and are ready to apply your knowledge to help clients optimize and transform their sales and service solutions.
  • Experienced with managing executive level client relationships, acting as a trusted advisor, while managing junior team members to deliver high-quality solutions.
  • Ready to dive deep into problem solving using creative and analytical thinking to transform challenges into opportunities.
  • Energized by working in an agile, fast-paced environment and are at your best when collaborating with a team.
  • Familiar with the selling processes and have pitched proposals and solutions to help solve client challenges.

The Work

As a Strategy Senior Manager, you will apply your deep expertise in sales & commerce to define and enable front office growth strategies and approaches to help clients achieve top line growth objectives with a focus on sales and channel / distribution. You will deliver on engagements in the following areas:

Thought Leadership

  • Able to understand client needs, develop proposed solutions, and deliver high-impact initiatives by consulting and partnering with our clients to help them support and transform their sales organizations and advance their position in Insurance.
  • Build client relationships to sustain Accentureâs profile as a long-term trusted advisor and partner.
  • Develop unique points of view on customer strategy topics or insurance markets relevant to our clients such as improving client satisfaction, achieving sales and revenue targets, and operational efficiency.
  • Manage and coach junior team members while continuing to grow your own expertise to help Accenture maintain its thought leadership position.

Delivery Execution

  • Design and execute large scale and complex transformation programs and strategy engagements including current state assessments, target state design, and operating model transformations.
  • Implement business changes that drive industry-specific, functional, and digital operating model transformation.
  • Synthesize overall technology needs by analyzing a wide variety of solutions, selecting the most relevant tools/techniques to meet specific client requirements.
  • Manage implementation engagements (requirements, design, test, deployment, etc.), from client buy-in to planning, budgeting, deliverables, and risk assessment, with heavy client engagement and large delivery teams.

Sales & Origination

  • Originate, qualify, and close new opportunities for Accenture with our Insurance industry clients, including sales (advisor) enablement, go-to-market strategies, direct to consumer growth, lead management, and sales operating model design.
  • Drive pipeline opportunities from initial idea to contract to implementation, leveraging the best capabilities and offerings across Accenture (Song, Strategy & Consulting, Technology, Operations).
  • Manage performance and profitability of sold deals, and identify opportunities for extension, cross-sell, or up-sell.

Hereâs What Youâll Need

  • 8+ years of Insurance industry experience, leading transformations specifically in a sales, operations, product or strategy role. A robust understanding of the Insurance industry including market trends and challenges and the regulatory environment, along with familiarity with topic areas such as sales (advisor) enablement, go-to-market strategies, direct to consumer growth, lead management, and sales operating model design, is required.
  • 5+ years of experience in strategy consulting, with broad experience in engagement management, business development, and leading complex programs / transformations.
  • 2+ year of experience with originating, qualifying, and closing new opportunities including developing sales proposals and/or engaging in business development activities.
  • 2 + year of experience with:â¯
  • Making strategic recommendations (or decisions) for critical experiences, products, or services of the organizationâ¯(and/or)
  • Managing a P&L or a pipeline of business development opportunities (and/or)
  • Providing enterprise level business or technology advisory all the way to c-suite executives - CEO, CTO, COO, and/or CIO.

Bonus Points If

  • You have excellent communication (written and spoken) and interpersonal skills, including compelling story telling skills for an executive audience and the ability to interact with diverse stakeholders.
  • You have strong client relationship development and client management skills.
  • You have experience in delivering CRM, CPQ, Lead to Order, Sales Transformation implementations.
  • You have experience working with onshore and offshore delivery teams.
  • You bring an existing network of relationships within the Financial Services industry at decision making levels (MD, VP or up).
  • You are familiar with AI, GenAI, or other emerging technologies.

Compensation at Accenture varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by local law, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired as set forth below.

  • Communicate your vision extensively with stakeholders across the organization, particularly in the marketing department
  • Manage a team of product owners in supporting them to execute on their roadmaps.
  • Act quickly on trends and opportunities by staying up to date on an extremely dynamic and competitive industry

Accor Tech & Digital, jobs in the tech field where intelligence is above all human!

Job Description

Accor Tech & Digital is the innovation and technological transformation lab of the world leader in hospitality.

Our teams, known as HeartistsÂ®, bring together the best of hospitality with the best of tech and digital. Our ambition is to provide our customers with personalized, memorable, and sustainable experiences.

Here, we create new ways to travel within each of our 5,500 hotels, connecting closely with our 100 million clients in 110 countries.

Here, we are at the heart of an incredible playground for technological transition and the design of digital products and services for our customers and hotel teams.

Here, your scope will know no boundaries;

So join us and dare to make an impact on the world!

Job Description

Here is where your greatest challenge awaits you:

As a Key Account Manager Corporate Development, you will play a key role in growing Accorâs market share and revenue with a portfolio of strategic corporate clients. Your main objective will be to strengthen partnerships with these high-potential accounts by optimizing their spending and maximizing adoption of all our dedicated offers, including our loyalty program, specifically for individual business travel. You will be at the heart of our strategy for developing and retaining clients in the Corporate Individual segment.

Your Mission:

Business Development and Strategy:

  • Build and execute a dedicated commercial strategy for your portfolio of corporate accounts, identifying growth drivers and opportunities to increase spending in the Corporate Individual segment.
  • Define a precise tactical action plan and analyze performance to ensure achievement of revenue and market share objectives.
  • Develop an in-depth understanding of your clientsâ needs and challenges to offer tailored solutions for their individual travelers.
  • Increase the presence and revenue of Accor hotels regionally/globally within your portfolio for the Corporate Individual segment.

Client Relationship Management:

  • Establish and maintain strong, lasting relationships with key decision-makers within your portfolio companies.
  • Identify and anticipate client needs to strengthen their commitment to Accor for individual travel.
  • Actively promote Accorâs corporate offers and highlight the benefits of the loyalty program to your clients for their business trips.

Negotiation And Contract Optimization:

  • Organize and respond to Requests for Proposals (RFPs) from your dedicated client portfolio, building competitive proposals focused on Corporate Individual.
  • Develop the corporate pricing strategy in synergy with Revenue Management/Pricing teams.
  • Ensure and test the correct loading of negotiated rates and conditions for your clients.
  • Optimize the competitiveness of negotiated rates compared to direct and indirect competitors.

Qualifications

And you?

  • Significant experience of 3+ years in a B2B commercial role, ideally as a Key Account Manager in hospitality, tourism, or a service sector.
  • Demonstrated ability to develop an existing client portfolio and identify new growth opportunities.
  • Excellent negotiation, persuasion, and communication skills.
  • Strong results orientation and ability to work independently.
  • Analytical skills, autonomy, proactivity, and interpersonal ease.
  • Mastery of sales and client retention techniques.
  • In-depth knowledge of the challenges and specifics of the Corporate Individual market (business travel).
  • Proficiency in IT tools (Office Suite) and ideally CRM tools.
  • Proactive, rigorous, and a team player.
  • Languages: French AND English (advanced), Spanish would be a plus.

Additional Information

Accor Dares To Impact:

  • the world

  • We adopt a continuous improvement approach to reduce the impact of digital on the environment across all our projects.
  • your career

  • Training and career paths are defined both individually and collectively, allowing us to grow together on a daily basis.
  • Specifically, at Accor Tech & Digital:
  • Remote work in France and flexible work options: work from home, our offices or even our hotels and coworking spaces.
  • Every Wednesday afternoon, dedicate your time to deep work and personal development.
  • Work in a multicultural and English-speaking environment.
  • Continuous improvement & training: Hackathons, exceptional technology partnerships, dedicated talent management, and a dedicated training platform, Digitech Academy & certifications.

and also,

  • ALL - HeartistÂ® Program: unforgettable stays and experiences at all Accor locations and partner venues worldwide.
  • HeartistÂ® for Good Program: commit to supporting an association of your choice from those available on our volunteering platform (1 day offered per year by the Group during your working hours).

The B2B Pricing team sits within B2B Marketing and partners with Product, Commercial, Finance, and Data Science to define, test, and scale strategies that drive sustainable growth and profitability for Agoda and our partners. We combine deep analytical rigor with an experimentation mindset to optimize across marketing levers (primarily pricing) and advise on growth across B2B2C channels.

The Opportunity:

As Manager, B2B Pricing, you will own pricing strategy and execution while acting as a consultative, dataâdriven advisor to B2B2C growth initiatives. Youâll translate commercial goals into testable pricing and marketing levers, design measurement, and lead crossâfunctional rollouts that improve business outcomes. You will work closely with the commercial organization and crossâfunctional stakeholders, serving as a goâto partner for pricing and growth decisions for key partners (e.g., large loyalty programs, marketplaces, and digital wallets such as Rakuten or Paytm).

In this role, youâll get to:

  • Define and evolve pricing strategies, segmentation, and marketing action for partners.
  • Lead the experimentation roadmap (A/B and multivariate tests), including hypotheses, success metrics, and decision frameworks.
  • Build marketing roadmaps and analyses (elasticity, cannibalization, incrementality) to advise relevant marketing actions.
  • Act as a consultative growth advisor to partner teams: coâcreate joint plans, model impact/P&L, align OKRs, and operationalize execution across channels.
  • Build playbooks to scale winning strategies across markets and partners; document learnings and institutionalize best practices.
  • Create Tableau dashboards and crisp executive narratives that synthesize performance, insights, and recommendations; drive action in weekly/monthly reviews.
  • Vendor/Partner Management: Manage relationships with external partners including strategic presentations.

What youâll need to succeed:

  • 5+ years in data-driven role, revenue/growth, marketing, strategy, or analytics roles in eâcommerce, travel, tech;
  • Strong business acumen and structured problemâsolving; ability to frame tradeâoffs, model scenarios, and influence decisions with clear âsoâwhat.â
  • Fluency with data: advanced Excel, SQL, and Tableau; comfort with large datasets and experiment readouts.
  • Practical experience with controlled experiments.
  • Exceptional stakeholder management and communication; able to simplify complex analyses for senior and partner audiences and drive alignment.
  • High ownership and bias for action; thrive in an ambiguous, fastâpaced, testâandâlearn environment.
  • BA/BS in a quantitative field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Engineering) or equivalent experience.

Itâs great if you have:

  • Building decision frameworks in production.
  • Background in management consulting or internal strategy (e.g., growth, pricing, or partnerships).
  • MBA or advanced degree is a plus; we value equivalent operating experience and measurable outcomes.
  • Familiarity with Python/R for modeling and scaling analysis.
  • Domain exposure to B2B channels, partner/affiliate programs, or wholesale/whitelabel constructs.

Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In this role, youâll get to:

  • Spearhead the development, execution, and optimization strategy for growing Agodaâs new & emerging marketing channels
  • Conduct end-to-end analysis of large, complex datasets related to channel performance, user behavior, and market trends, translating raw data into actionable insights
  • Develop hypotheses, design experiments (e.g., A/B tests), and build structured analyses to rigorously evaluate campaign effectiveness and drive data-driven decisions for channel growth
  • Partner closely with various business functions to identify opportunities, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets using different techniques and tools such as SQL or Tableau
  • Communicate complex findings, performance updates, and strategic recommendations clearly and concisely to key stakeholders, including senior management.

What youâll need to succeed:

  • 4-6 years of experience in Data Analyst position in tech, consulting, e-commerce or digital marketing.
  • Bachelorâs degree in Computer Science/Statistics/Math or Engineering or Economics and Finance
  • Data-Driven Approach: Strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze data, translate data into actionable insights, and generate impactful recommendations.
  • Proficient in business intelligence tools and data warehouse i.e. SQL, Tableau and MS Excel
  • Innovative Problem-Solving Skills: The ability to tackle complex challenges in a non-linear fashion is essential. We seek a resourceful candidate who can effectively navigate the organization to gather necessary information and implement innovative solutions while adapting to evolving scenarios and leveraging valuable resources creatively.
  • Stakeholder management & communication: Ability to effectively communicate, influence and persuade with different levels of stakeholders (including Senior Management) with proven strong commercial acumen

job.title: Manager, PPC Marketing (Bangkok-based, relocation provided)
job.description:
About Agoda

At Agoda, we bridge the world through travel. Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world.

Today, we are part of Booking Holdings [NASDAQ: BKNG], with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe. Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.

No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If youâre ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us.

Summary

In the online travel industry, with fast changing user behavior and the increasing role played by price comparison websites, offering the best price grants disproportionate gains. Travelers chose Agoda because they are confident that they can find there the best hotels, at the best price. Success can only be achieved by combining a programmatic approach to optimize volumes and margins in the short term with a strategic approach to take into account the reactions from the other players in the game, from customers to hotels, from competitors to regulatory bodies. To this end, we are looking for a senior leader to craft Agodaâs global marketing strategy and execute upon it, using a wide range of tactics and tools, from price display to machine learning algorithms. You will closely coordinate with Agodaâs senior management, marketing and product teams, while managing and expanding a team of talented pricing campaign managers and analysts.

What you will be doing:

  • Strategy Development: Develop and refine PPC strategy in line with overall business goals and market trends.
  • Performance Management: Monitor channel performance and efficiency (ROI, spend, and other key KPIs).
  • Stakeholder Communication: Regularly communicate performance, insights, and recommendations to senior leadership and cross-functional teams.
  • Process Improvement: Identify and implement process improvements to increase team efficiency and campaign effectiveness.
  • Vendor/Partner Management: Manage relationships with external partners (e.g., Google, Bing, agencies) and negotiate contracts or terms as needed.
  • Talent Development: Mentor, train, and develop team members to build skills and support career growth.
  • Innovation & Experimentation: Foster a culture of testing and innovation, encouraging the team to explore new channels, tools, and bidding strategies.
  • Insights: Analyze and explore data to seed projects, understand test performance, and execute on key team goals that require complex implementation or analysis.

What you need to be good at to succeed in this role:

  • Strong analytical skills and a passion for working with data to drive business decisions.
  • Advance proficiency in SQL
  • Experience in the online travel or e-commerce industry is a plus.
  • Proven ability to collaborate effectively across teams and cultures.
  • People management experience, including hiring, coaching, and developing team members.
  • Experience managing budgets and delivering results against financial targets.
  • A proactive, entrepreneurial mindset with a strong sense of ownership and a get-things-done attitude.
  • Exposure to product development, technology, or working with IT teams is an advantage.

We seek a resourceful candidate who can effectively navigate the organization to gather necessary information and implement innovative solutions while adapting to evolving scenarios and leveraging valuable resources creatively.

Success can only be achieved by combining a programmatic approach to optimize volumes and margins in the short term with a strategic approach to take into account the reactions from the other players in the game, from customers to hotels, from competitors to regulatory bodies. job.title: Associate Manager/Manager, B2B Pricing (Bangkok-based, relocation provided)
job.description:
About Agoda

At Agoda, we bridge the world through travel. Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world.

Today, we are part of Booking Holdings [NASDAQ: BKNG], with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe. Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.

No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If youâre ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us.

Get to know our team:

The B2B Pricing team sits within B2B Marketing and partners with Product, Commercial, Finance, and Data Science to define, test, and scale strategies that drive sustainable growth and profitability for Agoda and our partners. We combine deep analytical rigor with an experimentation mindset to optimize across marketing levers (primarily pricing) and advise on growth across B2B2C channels.

The Opportunity:

As Manager, B2B Pricing, you will own pricing strategy and execution while acting as a consultative, dataâdriven advisor to B2B2C growth initiatives. Youâll translate commercial goals into testable pricing and marketing levers, design measurement, and lead crossâfunctional rollouts that improve business outcomes. You will work closely with the commercial organization and crossâfunctional stakeholders, serving as a goâto partner for pricing and growth decisions for key partners (e.g., large loyalty programs, marketplaces, and digital wallets such as Rakuten or Paytm).

In this role, youâll get to:

  • Define and evolve pricing strategies, segmentation, and marketing action for partners.
  • Lead the experimentation roadmap (A/B and multivariate tests), including hypotheses, success metrics, and decision frameworks.
  • Build marketing roadmaps and analyses (elasticity, cannibalization, incrementality) to advise relevant marketing actions.
  • Act as a consultative growth advisor to partner teams: coâcreate joint plans, model impact/P&L, align OKRs, and operationalize execution across channels.
  • Build playbooks to scale winning strategies across markets and partners; document learnings and institutionalize best practices.
  • Create Tableau dashboards and crisp executive narratives that synthesize performance, insights, and recommendations; drive action in weekly/monthly reviews.
  • Vendor/Partner Management: Manage relationships with external partners including strategic presentations.

What youâll need to succeed:

  • 5+ years in data-driven role, revenue/growth, marketing, strategy, or analytics roles in eâcommerce, travel, tech;
  • Strong business acumen and structured problemâsolving; ability to frame tradeâoffs, model scenarios, and influence decisions with clear âsoâwhat.â
  • Fluency with data: advanced Excel, SQL, and Tableau; comfort with large datasets and experiment readouts.
  • Practical experience with controlled experiments.
  • Exceptional stakeholder management and communication; able to simplify complex analyses for senior and partner audiences and drive alignment.
  • High ownership and bias for action; thrive in an ambiguous, fastâpaced, testâandâlearn environment.
  • BA/BS in a quantitative field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Engineering) or equivalent experience.

Itâs great if you have:

  • Building decision frameworks in production.
  • Background in management consulting or internal strategy (e.g., growth, pricing, or partnerships).
  • MBA or advanced degree is a plus; we value equivalent operating experience and measurable outcomes.
  • Familiarity with Python/R for modeling and scaling analysis.
  • Domain exposure to B2B channels, partner/affiliate programs, or wholesale/whitelabel constructs.
